results.idea: Competitor momentum adjusted by company size
results.description: Uses rel_ret_comp (high coverage, many users) and pv13_revere_index_cap (market cap, high coverage). Applied SUGGESTION1 by combining two fields; SUGGESTION4 by choosing high user/alphaCount fields. SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.8). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector). Kept implementation short and under operator/datafield limits. Confidence: 0.75 because competitor returns often lead idiosyncratic moves after size adjustment.

Combine rel_ret_cust (lower coverage) with rel_num_cust to weight by customer count. Applied SUGGESTION1. Because rel_ret_cust coverage <0.6, applied SUGGESTION3 via ts_backfill( rel_ret_cust, 5 ). Used high userCount for rel_num_cust. No vector ops. Confidence: 0.62 reflecting mixed coverage.

Use pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank (network hub score) and rel_ret_all (averaged returns of overlapping companies). Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 by selecting popular fields. Treated hub_rank as vector-like signal? Applied vec_avg to smooth per-instrument scores (SUGGESTION2). Confidence 0.68 due to proven network-centrality signals.

results.idea: Partner return momentum scaled by partner count
results.description: Combine rel_ret_part and rel_num_part. Applied SUGGESTION1. rel_ret_part coverage ~0.71 so ts_backfill not required. Scaled by count to prefer signals with many partners. Confidence 0.6 given moderate evidence.

Use pv13_com_page_rank (high coverage) and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4. PageRank treated as scalar centrality; no backfill needed. Confidence 0.7 as network centrality often amplifies competitor moves.

Combine rel_ret_cust (low coverage, used ts_backfill) and pv13_revere_index_cap. Applied SUGGESTION3 for rel_ret_cust and SUGGESTION1 for combination. Confidence 0.58 due to noisy customer return data.

Use pv13_revere_term_sector_total and pv13_revere_key_sector_total to detect concentrated terminal-sector exposure. Applied SUGGESTION1; both have high coverage so no backfill. Confidence 0.55 as sector concentration is slow-moving.

Combine single_sector_pureplay_company_count (low coverage) with rel_ret_all. Applied SUGGESTION3 to backfill pureplay count (coverage 0.3508). SUGGESTION1 used for combination. Confidence 0.5 because pure-play count is sparse.

results.idea: Customer network strength times recent returns
results.description: Use pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (network) and ts_returns(rel_ret_cust,3). Applied SUGGESTION2 by vec_avg on page_rank and SUGGESTION3 for rel_ret_cust (backfill). Confidence 0.65 from network·momentum interaction.

Measure dispersion of competitor returns using rel_ret_comp and rel_num_comp. Applied SUGGESTION1. Using ts_std_dev approximation via ts_std_dev on rel_ret_comp. No backfill required (coverage high). Confidence 0.67 as dispersion often precedes reversion or breakout.

Combine pv13_com_rk_au (competitor HITS authority) and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION2 wrapping authority as vec_avg for smoothing, and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.7 because authoritative competitors often lead industry moves.
Use rel_ret_part and rel_num_part, prefer signals where partner count is low (contrarian). Applied SUGGESTION1 and used subtract to invert weighting. Confidence 0.56; effect is plausible but modest.

Combine pv13_revere_country (country code) and pv13_revere_index_value to detect cross-country index shifts. SUGGESTION4 used pv13_revere_index_value high usage. Kept fields to 2 and no group-only usage. Confidence 0.52 since country-level signals are coarser.
Use pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION2 by vec_avg on PageRank to aggregate. No backfill needed. Confidence 0.69 due to combining centrality with returns.

results.idea: Customer return momentum vs competitor returns
results.description: Compare rel_ret_cust (backfilled) to rel_ret_comp to detect divergence. Applied SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION3 for rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.6; divergence between customers and competitors can foreshadow moves.

Use pv13_revere_level (coverage ~0.62) and pv13_revere_key_sector_total. Applied SUGGESTION3 if needed: ts_backfill on pv13_revere_level when missing. SUGGESTION1 used combination. Confidence 0.48 as hierarchical level is structural and slow.

Use pv13_revere_zipcode and rel_ret_all to capture locally clustered moves. Applied SUGGESTION1; zip code has high coverage so no backfill. Kept 2 fields only. Confidence 0.5 since zipcode signal can be noisy.

results.idea: Competitor returns scaled by competitor count
results.description: rel_ret_comp scaled by rel_num_comp to favor concentrated competitor reactions. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. No backfill. Confidence 0.66 as concentration matters.

Use pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank to create centrality spread. Applied SUGGESTION1 and vec_avg on both as vector-like. Confidence 0.61; centrality spreads indicate structural shifts.

results.idea: Index value breakout after competitor shock
results.description: Combine ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_value,1) with ts_delta(rel_ret_comp,1). SUGGESTION1 applied; both high coverage so no backfill. Confidence 0.64 detecting index response to competitor shocks.

results.idea: Weighted competitor return by product overlap
results.description: Use rel_ret_comp and rel_num_all (number overlapping companies). Applied SUGGESTION1; rel_num_all high coverage. Confidence 0.63: overlap-weighted returns can indicate direct competition risk.
pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (network) with ts_returns(rel_ret_cust,5) backfilled. Applied SUGGESTION2 vec_avg and SUGGESTION3 for rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.66 for network·momentum coupling.
pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank with rel_ret_part. Applied SUGGESTION1 and vec_avg for auth_rank. No backfill. Confidence 0.6: partner authority can influence returns.
rel_num_comp sudden changes vs rel_ret_comp. Use ts_delta on rel_num_comp and ts_zscore on rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION1; both high coverage. Confidence 0.58.
pv13_revere_term and pv13_revere_term_sector_total combined. pv13_revere_term low coverage -> ts_backfill applied. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.47 as term flags are structural.
pv13_com_rk_au and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank spread. Applied SUGGESTION1 and vec_avg on both. Confidence 0.63: divergence signals shifting influence.

results.idea: Customer count momentum adjusted by market cap
results.description: rel_num_cust (coverage ~0.507) backfilled and pv13_revere_index_cap. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.55 given moderate coverage.

results.idea: PageRank momentum cross-checked with competitor returns
results.description: pv13_com_page_rank and ts_delta(rel_ret_comp,1). SUGGESTION2 vec_avg on PageRank, SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.68.
pv13_revere_index_cap ts_delta with rel_ret_all to detect cap-driven returns. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Competitor average return vs overall overlap return
results.description: Compare rel_ret_comp with rel_ret_all to find idiosyncratic competitor moves. Applied SUGGESTION1; both high coverage. Confidence 0.65.
pv13_revere_key_sector_total and rel_ret_all: scale returns by key-sector breadth. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.53 as breadth effects are moderate.
Compute information ratio of customer returns using ts_ir on rel_ret_cust (backfilled). Applied SUGGESTION3 then ts_ir. Confidence 0.57 because IR helps signal persistent customer-driven returns.
Use ts_kurtosis on rel_ret_comp to detect tail events. SUGGESTION1 not needed (single field). rel_ret_comp has good coverage so no backfill. Confidence 0.59.
Spread between rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and rel_ret_comp. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.6.
Normalize rel_num_comp via zscore and multiply by rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.62.
Use ts_delta on pv13_com_page_rank to detect rising centrality. SUGGESTION2 vec_avg optional but kept simple. Confidence 0.58 as centrality shifts can precede market moves.

results.idea: Partner return momentum normalized by market cap
results.description: rel_ret_part scaled by pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION1 applied. Coverage adequate. Confidence 0.59.
rel_num_all ts_delta vs rel_ret_all to detect product-overlap shocks. Applied SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.54.
pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank (vec_avg) times rel_ret_cust (backfilled). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.64.
ts_av_diff on rel_ret_comp to measure deviation from its mean. Single-field approach (SUGGESTION1 not needed). Confidence 0.61.
Use rel_num_cust (backfilled) and pv13_revere_index_cap to proxy natural liquidity of demand. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.49; indirect proxy so lower confidence.

results.idea: Competitor returns scaled by terminal-sector concentration
results.description: Combine rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_term_sector_total. SUGGESTION1 used; both high coverage. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Index value momentum vs competitor momentum
results.description: ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,3) vs ts_returns(rel_ret_comp,3). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.6 for relative momentum signals.
ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,10) identifies volatility spikes. Single-field; SUGGESTION1 not applied. Confidence 0.58.
Compare rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and rel_ret_part to detect supply-chain splits. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Competitor return momentum normalized by product overlap
results.description: rel_ret_comp divided by rel_num_all. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.61.
vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank) * rel_ret_cust (backfilled). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.63.
Compare pv13_com_page_rank to company PageRank (if available) but here use pv13_com_page_rank and rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.66.
ts_delta(rel_num_part,1) times ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,5). Applied SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.55.
ts_std_dev(rel_ret_comp,10) weighted by vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.62.
ts_zscore(rel_ret_cust,5) with backfill due to coverage. SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.54.
ts_delta(ts_delta(rel_ret_comp,1),1) measures acceleration. Single-field approach. Confidence 0.6.
rel_ret_part divided by pv13_revere_index_cap to favor impactful partner returns. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
ts_zscore(rel_ret_all,7) weighted by rel_num_all. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.6.
ts_corr between rel_ret_comp and pv13_revere_index_value over 20 days. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Customer PageRank minus competitor PageRank spread
results.description: vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) - vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank). Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Key sector breadth vs company size
results.description: pv13_revere_key_sector_total divided by pv13_revere_index_cap. SUGGESTION1 and SUGGESTION4 applied. Confidence 0.5.
Multiply ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7) by rel_num_all to emphasize overlapping product moves. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.62.
ts_ir of spread between rel_ret_cust (backfilled) and rel_ret_part. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.58.
Use ts_step or ts_arg_max? Simpler: ts_rank of rel_ret_comp over 5 days to detect day-of-week anomalies. Single-field approach. Confidence 0.52.
vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) * ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,9). SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: Competitor return relative to sector-term totals
results.description: rel_ret_comp divided by pv13_revere_term_sector_total. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.
rel_ret_cust (backfilled) divided by rel_num_all to find per-overlap-return. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.53.
vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank) * ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,8). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Index cap acceleration vs competitor returns
results.description: ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_cap,3) * ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,5). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.57.
ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,3) as fast momentum. Single-field. Confidence 0.6.
vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) - vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank). Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.55.
ts_delta(rel_num_comp,5) as signal of changing competition. Single-field used. Confidence 0.51.
ts_std_dev(rel_ret_all,10) weighted by rel_num_all. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.56.
vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) - ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,5),10). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.6.
reverse(ts_zscore(pv13_revere_key_sector_total,20)). Single-field breadth mean reversion. Confidence 0.49.
ts_corr(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_index_value, 10) to detect coupling. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
ts_std_dev(ts_backfill(rel_num_cust,5),10) as measure of demand instability. Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.5.
vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) * ts_corr(rel_ret_comp, ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,10), 20). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Partner count as stability filter for returns
results.description: Use rel_num_part to dampen noisy rel_ret_part signals: divide rel_ret_part by (1+rel_num_part). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.52.
reverse(ts_zscore(ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank),3),10)). Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7) with ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,7),7). Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Competitor returns normalized by terminal-sector presence
results.description: Divide rel_ret_comp by pv13_revere_term to upweight terminal sector competitors (backfilled pv13_revere_term). SUGGESTION3 applied. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Overlap count trend vs competitor returns
results.description: ts_delta(rel_num_all,5) * ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Customer PageRank momentum filtered by index cap
results.description: vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) * divide(ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,5),10), pv13_revere_index_cap). Applied SUGGESTION2, SUGGESTION3, SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.63.
ts_zscore(ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank),3),10) detects rising hub influence. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.57.
ts_delta(ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,5),1) as a fast acceleration measure. Single-field approach. Confidence 0.52.
vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) * ts_std_dev(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,10),10). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.6.
Subtract ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,10) from ts_zscore(pv13_revere_index_value,10) to find relative strength. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Product overlap growth vs customer returns
results.description: ts_delta(rel_num_all,7) * ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,7),10). Applied SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.54.
pv13_revere_key_sector_total * ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.51.
zscore(pv13_revere_index_cap) used as a filter multiplier for other signals. Single-field example. Confidence 0.48.
ts_product(rel_ret_comp,5) to detect sustained directional moves. Single-field. Confidence 0.55.
ts_quantile(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,7),7) to identify extremes. Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Competitor authority zscore divergence from mean
results.description: zscore(subtract(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), ts_mean(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au),20))). Applied SUGGESTION2. Confidence 0.6.
Subtract ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7) from ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,7). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.53.
ts_arg_max(rel_ret_comp,10) to detect most recent local maxima. Single-field. Confidence 0.5.
winsorize(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,7), std=3). Applied SUGGESTION3 and winsorize to reduce outliers. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competitor return scaled by zipcode concentration
results.description: Divide ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7) by pv13_revere_zipcode to emphasize localized moves. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.47.
zscore(divide(ts_backfill(rel_num_cust,5), add(rel_num_comp,1))). Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.5.
vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) * divide(ts_zscore(rel_ret_all,7), add(rel_num_all,1)). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Partner mean reversion filtered by hub-score
results.description: reverse(divide(ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,10), add(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank),1))). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.55.
ts_ir(divide(rel_ret_comp, add(rel_num_all,1)), 20) to find persistent overlap-driven returns. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Customer vs competitor return rolling correlation
results.description: ts_corr(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,10), rel_ret_comp, 20). Applied SUGGESTION3 & SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.59.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), ts_zscore(ts_delta(rel_ret_comp,1),5)). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.66.
ts_delta(rel_num_part,3) vs ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,5) combined. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.52.
ts_quantile(rel_ret_comp,7) to detect extreme deciles. Single-field. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Index cap vs sector breadth mean reversion
results.description: reverse(divide(pv13_revere_index_cap, add(pv13_revere_key_sector_total,1))). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.46.
subtract(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,7)). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.54.
ts_mean(rel_ret_comp,20) to capture slow-moving competitive pressure. Single-field. Confidence 0.5.
reverse(ts_zscore(rel_num_all,20)). Single-field. Confidence 0.45.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank), ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,10)) using SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.6.
ts_delta(pv13_revere_term_sector_total,7) * ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,7). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.49.
ts_product(rel_ret_comp,3) to detect consecutive moves. Single-field. Confidence 0.53.
divide(ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,7),10), pv13_revere_zipcode). Applied SUGGESTION3 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.46.
vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) - ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,7). Applied SUGGESTION2 and SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.51.
